title: Little Creature
provenance_text:
John B. Flannagan [1895-1942]; likely Buchholz Gallery, New York, NY [1]; Edgar J. Kaufmann [1885-1955], Pittsburgh, PA, by June 1941 [2]. G. David Thompson [1899-1965], Pittsburgh, PA, by October 1963 until likely June 26, 1965 [3]; his wife, Helene S. Thompson [?-1982], Pittsburgh, PA, likely 1965 until February 12, 1976 [4]; her gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1976.

Notes:
[1]. See reference to the Buchholz Gallery and its head, Curt Valentin, in note [2] below.  
[2]. The artist began a letter to Edgar Kaufmann as follows: "Im glad to hear from Curt Valentin; my carved rock "Little Creature" has passed into your Im sure good hands. (sic)" See original letter from the artist to Edgar Kaufmann in curatorial file. The letter was forward to Mr. Kaufmann by the Buchholz Gallery on June 17, 1941. It was given to the museum by Edgar Kaufmann, Jr. in January 1977.
[3]. Mr. Thompson lent the sculpture to the Flannagan exhibition at the University of Notre Dame's Art Gallery in 1963; the exhibition opened on October 6, 1963. 
[4]. Mrs. Thompson likely inherited the sculpture on her husband's death on June 26, 1965. She lent it (no. 23) to the exhibition "Sculpture We Live with: Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, November 1968 - January 1969.

creator.birth_place: Fargo (Cass county, North Dakota, United States)
creator.death_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
